timeline.message: [#315] removed unnecessary precision in background hexes
improved item rendering (using bigger single char if shortname is present)
[#314] removed old png icons, inserted preliminary logo
[#314] renamed icons to iconmapping, fixed usage
[#262] removed local serving of icons and vendor icons
[#314] bumped wiremock and jackson-databind to omit class not found error

timeline.author: mfbieber

replies.bodyText: I've been lazy and made it package-private for testing. 🙈
replies.author: bonndan

replies.bodyText: But I did not see it being used in the tests - did I overlook this?
replies.author: mfbieber

replies.bodyText: LocalIconsTest uses it. Maybe it were better to return an Optional and get rid of the boolean flag.
replies.author: bonndan

replies.bodyText:
Oh, yes.
Yes, that would be better!
replies.author: mfbieber

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/src/main/java/de/bonndan/nivio/output/icons/LocalIcons.java b/src/main/java/de/bonndan/nivio/output/icons/LocalIcons.java
index 4653592c..51336f23 100644
--- a/src/main/java/de/bonndan/nivio/output/icons/LocalIcons.java
+++ b/src/main/java/de/bonndan/nivio/output/icons/LocalIcons.java

@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@ import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
 import static de.bonndan.nivio.output.icons.IconMapping.DEFAULT_ICON;
 
 /**
- * Provides icons and vendor icons as data.
+ * Provides the builtin icons (shipped with nivio) and vendor icons (loaded form remote locations) as embeddable data.
  *
  *
  */

timeline.bodyText:
This is the only place where vendorIcons.getUrl() is used, so I was at first a little confused about what LocalIcons really is. I thought LocalIcons are icons addes by the user? Is this correct? (In this case, maybe a different naming would be better. Why not just Icons?)
Or does it mean that there are not retrieved from a remote location such as the vendor icons?
timeline.author: mfbieber

replies.bodyText: LocalIcons is a crappy name, but I had no better idea. It stands for the locally (fs) available svg icons that come shipped with nivio. They are loaded and embedded, so nivio does not serve anything anymore.
replies.author: bonndan

replies.bodyText:
Okay, I think for the users it is okay. As I developer, I now understand. Maybe we can add a brief comment to the class, so others developers understand too?
In this case I also did not come up with a better name. "BuiltInIcons" could be another idea.
replies.author: mfbieber

replies.bodyText: One more ugly aspect is that it is named to handle local icons, but suddenly comes up with remote vendor icons. I don't like my design here.
replies.author: bonndan

replies.bodyText: Yes, that is exactly what I was wondering about.
replies.author: mfbieber

diff --git a/src/main/java/de/bonndan/nivio/output/icons/LocalIcons.java b/src/main/java/de/bonndan/nivio/output/icons/LocalIcons.java
index 4653592c..51336f23 100644
--- a/src/main/java/de/bonndan/nivio/output/icons/LocalIcons.java
+++ b/src/main/java/de/bonndan/nivio/output/icons/LocalIcons.java

@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@ import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
 import static de.bonndan.nivio.output.icons.IconMapping.DEFAULT_ICON;
 
 /**
- * Provides icons and vendor icons as data.
+ * Provides the builtin icons (shipped with nivio) and vendor icons (loaded form remote locations) as embeddable data.
  *
  *
  */
